<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the function ran by the CrashRecoveryContext crashes or fails, then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#39;RetCode&#39; represents the returned error code, as if it was returned by a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// process. &#39;Context&#39; represents the signal type on Unix; on Windows, it is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the ExceptionContext.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-crashrecoverycontext-cpp-/crashrecoverycontextimpl/#a0f8515fbcec00f4cf6990321677ebdbd"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-crashrecoverycontext-cpp-/crashrecoverycontextimpl/#a0f8515fbcec00f4cf6990321677ebdbd">HandleCrash</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RetCode, uintptr&#95;t Context) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Eliminate the current context entry, to avoid re-entering in case the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// cleanup code crashes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-crashrecoverycontext-cpp-/#a04bd06e1fbf71b7df3cc3b119d9309d1">CurrentContext</a> = <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-crashrecoverycontext-cpp-/crashrecoverycontextimpl/#a94c0fd5a8b423857291b1ba6d49f41a8">Next</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-crashrecoverycontext-cpp-/crashrecoverycontextimpl/#afe3b2dc63d72670464e9e11c5a572281">Failed</a> &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Crash recovery context already failed!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &lt;windows.h&gt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for GetExceptionInformation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If &#95;MSC&#95;VER is defined, we must have SEH. Use it if it&#39;s available. It&#39;s way</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// better than VEH. Vectored exception handling catches all exceptions happening</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// on the thread with installed exception handlers, so it can interfere with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// internal exception handling of other libraries on that thread. SEH works</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// exactly as you would expect normal exception handling to work: it only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// catches exceptions if they would bubble out from the stack frame with &#95;&#95;try /</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#95;&#95;except.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is a non-MSVC compiler, probably mingw gcc or clang without</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// -fms-extensions. Use vectored exception handling (VEH).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// On Windows, we can make use of vectored exception handling to catch most</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// crashing situations.  Note that this does mean we will be alerted of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// exceptions &#42;before&#42; structured exception handling has the opportunity to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// catch it. Unfortunately, this causes problems in practice with other code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// running on threads with LLVM crash recovery contexts, so we would like to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// eventually move away from VEH.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Vectored works on a per-thread basis, which is an advantage over</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SetUnhandledExceptionFilter. SetUnhandledExceptionFilter also doesn&#39;t have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// any native support for chaining exception handlers, but VEH allows more than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// one.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The vectored exception handler functionality was added in Windows</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// XP, so if support for older versions of Windows is required,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// it will have to be added.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/include/llvm/support/windows/windowssupport-h">llvm/Support/Windows/WindowsSupport.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that we don&#39;t actually get here because HandleCrash calls</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// longjmp, which means the HandleCrash function never returns.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/errorhandling-h/#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94">llvm&#95;unreachable</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Handled the crash, should have longjmp&#39;ed out of here&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Because the Enable and Disable calls are static, it means that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// there may not actually be an Impl available, or even a current</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// CrashRecoveryContext at all.  So we make use of a thread-local</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// exception table.  The handles contained in here will either be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// non-NULL, valid VEH handles, or NULL.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a793005af6ae802d5a2a2e8ceb4ac2135">LLVM&#95;THREAD&#95;LOCAL</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#42; sCurrentExceptionHandle;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#afafe7a6e51a65dc858e161f5f0346eb7">installExceptionOrSignalHandlers</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We can set up vectored exception handling now.  We will install our</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// handler as the front of the list, though there&#39;s no assurances that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// it will remain at the front (another call could install itself before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// our handler).  This 1) isn&#39;t likely, and 2) shouldn&#39;t cause problems.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlight">  PVOID handle = ::AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, ExceptionHandler);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlight">  sCurrentExceptionHandle = handle;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a72432dde4ac5721bf8d78d090a198dc6">uninstallExceptionOrSignalHandlers</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlight">  PVOID currentHandle = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const&#95;cast&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">PVOID</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">&gt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(sCurrentExceptionHandle);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (currentHandle) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Now we can remove the vectored exception handler from the chain</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlight">    ::RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(currentHandle);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Reset the handle in our thread-local set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlight">    sCurrentExceptionHandle = NULL;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#else </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// !&#95;WIN32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Generic POSIX implementation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This implementation relies on synchronous signals being delivered to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// current thread. We use a thread local object to keep track of the active</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// crash recovery context, and install signal handlers to invoke HandleCrash on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the active object.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This implementation does not attempt to chain signal handlers in any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// reliable fashion -- if we get a signal outside of a crash recovery context we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// simply disable crash recovery and raise the signal again.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &lt;signal.h&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347" lineLink="#a610cf56a4e6ab035bbce5e4bd4b35491"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a610cf56a4e6ab035bbce5e4bd4b35491">Signals</a>&#91;&#93; =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#123; SIGABRT, SIGBUS, SIGFPE, SIGILL, SIGSEGV, SIGTRAP &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349" lineLink="#a2c9e1adb1243628fba0a85d1679c5408"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a2c9e1adb1243628fba0a85d1679c5408">NumSignals</a> = std::size(<a href="#a610cf56a4e6ab035bbce5e4bd4b35491">Signals</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350" lineLink="#a78ca6b94aa2c38681accbf6cfbd577e6"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">sigaction <a href="#a78ca6b94aa2c38681accbf6cfbd577e6">PrevActions</a>&#91;<a href="#a2c9e1adb1243628fba0a85d1679c5408">NumSignals</a>&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352" lineLink="#a63942c4dec8efd06218370c042a12480"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a63942c4dec8efd06218370c042a12480">CrashRecoverySignalHandler</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Signal) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Lookup the current thread local recovery object.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;CRCI = CurrentContext;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!CRCI) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We didn&#39;t find a crash recovery context -- this means either we got a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// signal on a thread we didn&#39;t expect it on, the application got a signal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// outside of a crash recovery context, or something else went horribly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// wrong.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Disable crash recovery and raise the signal again. The assumption here is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that the enclosing application will terminate soon, and we won&#39;t want to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// attempt crash recovery again.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This call of Disable isn&#39;t thread safe, but it doesn&#39;t actually matter.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a85c3b9e248b6ed94762938f8cac81a49">CrashRecoveryContext::Disable</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><span class="doxyHighlight">    raise(Signal);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The signal will be thrown once the signal mask is restored.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Unblock the signal we received.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><span class="doxyHighlight">  sigset&#95;t SigMask;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><span class="doxyHighlight">  sigemptyset(&amp;SigMask);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><span class="doxyHighlight">  sigaddset(&amp;SigMask, Signal);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><span class="doxyHighlight">  sigprocmask(SIG&#95;UNBLOCK, &amp;SigMask, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Return the same error code as if the program crashed, as mentioned in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// section &quot;Exit Status for Commands&quot;:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/xrat/V4&#95;xcu&#95;chap02.html</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RetCode = 128 + Signal;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Don&#39;t consider a broken pipe as a crash (see clang/lib/Driver/Driver.cpp)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Signal == SIGPIPE)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><span class="doxyHighlight">    RetCode = EX&#95;IOERR;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (CRCI)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const&#95;cast&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">&gt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(CRCI)-&gt;HandleCrash(RetCode, Signal);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393" lineLink="#afafe7a6e51a65dc858e161f5f0346eb7"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#afafe7a6e51a65dc858e161f5f0346eb7">installExceptionOrSignalHandlers</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Setup the signal handler.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">sigaction Handler;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Handler.sa&#95;handler = <a href="#a63942c4dec8efd06218370c042a12480">CrashRecoverySignalHandler</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Handler.sa&#95;flags = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><span class="doxyHighlight">  sigemptyset(&amp;Handler.sa&#95;mask);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> i = 0; i != <a href="#a2c9e1adb1243628fba0a85d1679c5408">NumSignals</a>; ++i) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><span class="doxyHighlight">    sigaction(<a href="#a610cf56a4e6ab035bbce5e4bd4b35491">Signals</a>&#91;i&#93;, &amp;Handler, &amp;<a href="#a78ca6b94aa2c38681accbf6cfbd577e6">PrevActions</a>&#91;i&#93;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405" lineLink="#a72432dde4ac5721bf8d78d090a198dc6"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a72432dde4ac5721bf8d78d090a198dc6">uninstallExceptionOrSignalHandlers</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Restore the previous signal handlers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> i = 0; i != <a href="#a2c9e1adb1243628fba0a85d1679c5408">NumSignals</a>; ++i)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><span class="doxyHighlight">    sigaction(<a href="#a610cf56a4e6ab035bbce5e4bd4b35491">Signals</a>&#91;i&#93;, &amp;<a href="#a78ca6b94aa2c38681accbf6cfbd577e6">PrevActions</a>&#91;i&#93;, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// !&#95;WIN32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a7a27e5f3ab2b30dd6b1ef4c8d7e9e5a4"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a7a27e5f3ab2b30dd6b1ef4c8d7e9e5a4">CrashRecoveryContext::RunSafely</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight">()&gt; Fn) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If crash recovery is disabled, do nothing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (gCrashRecoveryEnabled) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!Impl &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Crash recovery context already initialized!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><span class="doxyHighlight">    CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;CRCI = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">new</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CrashRecoveryContextImpl(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">this</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Impl = CRCI;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><span class="doxyHighlight">    CRCI-&gt;ValidJumpBuffer = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (setjmp(CRCI-&gt;JumpBuffer) != 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Fn();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// !&#95;MSC&#95;VER</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a37a76700bffd3d25b09e7828fa90277c"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#91;&#91;noreturn&#93;&#93; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a37a76700bffd3d25b09e7828fa90277c">CrashRecoveryContext::HandleExit</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if defined(&#95;WIN32)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Since the exception code is actually of NTSTATUS type, we use the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Microsoft-recommended 14 prefix, to signify that this is a user error.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This value is a combination of the customer field (bit 29) and severity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// field (bits 30-31) in the NTSTATUS specification.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><span class="doxyHighlight">  ::RaiseException(0xE0000000 | <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a>, 0, 0, NULL);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// On Unix we don&#39;t need to raise an exception, we go directly to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// HandleCrash(), then longjmp will unwind the stack for us.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><span class="doxyHighlight">  CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;CRCI = (CrashRecoveryContextImpl &#42;)Impl;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(CRCI &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Crash recovery context never initialized!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><span class="doxyHighlight">  CRCI-&gt;HandleCrash(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a>, 0 </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42;no sig num&#42;/</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/errorhandling-h/#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94">llvm&#95;unreachable</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Most likely setjmp wasn&#39;t called!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a0cd4fbb22cd917e20bb699958b4339b2"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#a0cd4fbb22cd917e20bb699958b4339b2">CrashRecoveryContext::isCrash</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if defined(&#95;WIN32)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// On Windows, the code is interpreted as NTSTATUS. The two high bits</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// represent the severity. Values starting with 2147483648 are reserved for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &quot;warnings&quot;; values of 3221225472 and up are for &quot;errors&quot;. In practice, both</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// are interpreted as a non-continuable signal.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Code = ((unsigned)<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a> &amp; 0xF0000000) &gt;&gt; 28;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Code != 12 &amp;&amp; Code != 8)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// On Unix, signals are represented by return codes of 128 or higher.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Exit code 128 is a reserved value and should not be raised as a signal.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext/#aa79c730e28c1406ada1243fae0e0358d">RetCode</a> &lt;= 128)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
